unbundle.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to provide products or services separately that were previously sold together
unbundle.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Sky TV refused to unbundle its programme package to allow the cable companies to offer customers channels of their choice.
unbundle.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to separate activities that were previously managed together, usually in order to sell them
unbundle.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The company is expected to unbundle some of its Zimbabwe goldmining interests to local investors.
